runs.comm: back of a length outside off, defended towards point.
back of a length, a bit of width, and de Villiers flays it away dismissively. He just cleared his front leg and cracked it to the cover boundary
full on leg stump, clips de Villiers on the foot before rolling down to Dhoni
short, wide, walloped, just hits it up and over point and gives third man no chance
bouncer, rises over head height and Dhoni has to leap in the air to take that behind the stumps. AB doesn't have to move at all to evade it
shortish, a bit of width, slapped hard but straight to point

big inswinger, startles AB who was camped on the back foot, looking for that slap through the off side. Cramps him and smacks him on the pad, but Bhuvneshwar's appeal to the umpire isn't too confident. He knew that was swinging too far, down the leg side in all likelihood
flat, angling into the pads, whipped away to deep midwicket
this looked like the seam-up ball, swung away towards off stump as AB came forward, chose wisely to drive it back to the bowler
flat and full on middle and leg, swiped away across the line to deep midwicket
slower now, length ball on off stump, worked with the turn to the left of square leg
tossed up on off stump, a bit of drift away. Driven with the turn to long-on
got him! Fired that at the pads and Amla went for the flick. Didn't middle it, and it popped up in the direction of leg slip, where Rohit grabbed it after a juggle
length ball, turns into the pads, tucked away through square leg
full on middle and leg, flatter this time, clipped into the square leg region again
a bit of air on this, just gets his line wrong, down the leg side
length ball outside off, turns his wrists and plays it to midwicket
flatter and fuller on middle stump, driven with a straight bat to midwicket
tossed up a bit slower, middle-and-leg line, driven down to long-on
length ball, turns from middle to leg, tucked away quietly towards midwicket
fullish on middle and leg, clipped away to deep midwicket
this is the seam-up ball again, swings away from a good length on off stump, poked away defensively into the off side
and another, a bit fuller, driven to mid-off
tossed up slower on leg stump, clipped towards square leg
length ball on off stump, leaves the right-hander again, defended into the cover point region
flighted and full on off stump, driven to cover
tossed up on middle stump, worked with the turn to deep midwicket

that was nicely flighted by Harbhajan, and dipped sharply in the air, but Faf used his feet well, got to the pitch with a long second stride, didn't let his head fall over, and drove in the air, between the bowler and mid-off
down the track again, quietly drives this one to long-on
length ball on off stump, AB plays the checked drive back to the bowler
quicker and on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
lovely flight again from Harbhajan, dips and goes straight on outside off stump. Faf, pressing forward to play for the turn, plays and misses
slowly tossed up on off stump, driven into the gap between point and cover. Lovely use of the hands to find the gap, and they pick up three by the time Rayudu can chase back
down the track again comes Faf, and he gets right up to the pitch. The line - just outside off - gives him room to free his arms, and he does that very well to hit over mid-off
down the track again and this time he doesn't get as far to the pitch as before, and uses that room for leverage, and smashed it straight and high, over mid-off for six
flat and quick on middle and leg, tucked defensively towards midwicket

gone! Comes down the track again, sees a bit of flight. Looks to hit over the bowler again but doesn't quite time it - change of angle forced him to open his bat face - and Mohit, running backwards and to his right from mid-off, takes a superbly judged catch
flat length ball on leg stump, looks to work it leg side, the ball rolls off his pad to short fine leg
flighted length ball outside off, presses forward to defend into the off side
this one goes with the angle as he props forward to defend, playing for the turn. Harbhajan used to get Duminy out lbw a lot, exactly like this, in the past, but this one was missing leg stump
another slider, and this time Duminy is aware and defends back towards the bowler
flatter and fuller, down the leg side. Duminy misses the sweep, and the unsighted Dhoni can't collect cleanly either. Ball rolls away towards fine leg, and they pick up two apart from the wide
flat and full outside off, defended into the off side
down the track and the ball comes in with the angle, forcing Duminy to swipe across the line. Hits it into the vacant backward square leg region and picks up two
flattish, back of a length, outside off. Looks to cut, but there's no turn, and he ends up chopping it down into the pitch
flighted on middle and off, flicked with the turn to deep midwicket
back of a length, goes with the angle towards off stump. Makes room to cut, can't beat point
tossed up now, outside off, looks like the carrom ball, but it's too full to be of any consequence, and Duminy stretches out and flat-bats it to the cover boundary
looks to sweep now, and the ball bounces extra and beats him outside off
down the track, reaches the pitch and plays a checked drive to long-off

bowled him! That was beautifully done by Ashwin. Once again, bowls de Villiers with a change of pace. Was much slower than his previous deliveries, and de Villiers had to reach out to drive that. Didn't turn as much as he expected, and it beat his outside edge and hit top of off
length ball, slides on towards off stump. Goes on the back foot, lets it come on, and works it with the angle into the leg side
down the track first ball, whips it with the turn from outside off, down to long-on
length ball, slides in towards off and middle, blocked watchfully off the front foot
fuller now, along the same middle and off line, clipped to midwicket
loopy delivery on off stump, too full to trouble Duminy, who eases the drive down to long-off
flat, fired into the pads, worked away to deep square leg
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away towards deep midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, defended towards mid-on
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-on
quick bouncer, rising over the right shoulder. Behaardien drops his hands and sways out of the way

length ball on middle and leg, tucks up Behaardien, who has to pull his front pad out of the way to play that with a straight bat and push to mid-on. They decide quickly to run the single, and put pressure on Dhawan, who fumbles as he bends to pick up the ball
length ball on off stump, driven to the left of mid-off. Dhawan moves quickly this time, picks up, and hits the stumps direct at the bowler's end, but JP is safely home
length ball on the pads, tucked away to long leg
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length, too straight, tucked off the hips easily to the fine leg boundary
length ball outside off, looks to open his face and run it down towards third man, but backward point dives to his right and cuts it off
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, driven on the half-volley to extra cover, who throws the ball in the air in mock celebration, raising a cheer from the crowd
flighted ball outside off, driven to sweeper cover
length ball on middle stump. Goes on the back foot and tucks it to square leg
back of a length on off stump, punched off the back foot to midwicket
full on middle stump, driven down to long-on
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
flighted on leg stump, driven to long-on
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
full on middle and leg, clipped to deep backward square leg
length ball, skids on with the angle and hits him on the pad as he presses forward to defend. Ball pops off the pad wide of slip
full on off stump, clipped to midwicket
flat and full on off stump. Behaardien skips away from the stumps to make room, is forced to jab it defensively into the covers
length ball on off stump, blocked  back to the bowler
length ball, fourth-stump line, goes on the back foot and blocks to short extra cover
a bit slower and fuller on off stump, driven to long-off
down the track, the line gives him a bit of hitting room, and he smacks it hard down to long-off
down the track, gets too close to the pitch of the ball, which is right by his feet, and he clips it away into the midwicket region
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face to dab it into the short fine leg area
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room and stabs it out towards backward point
down the track and Axar fires it into Duminy's legs. Whipped away towards deep midwicket

length ball, slides on with the angle and utterly beats Behardien, who's stuck on the crease, expecting turn. In the end, he has no time to respond, and the ball strikes his front pad plumb in front. No hesitation from the umpire there
length ball on off stump, tucked away to the left of midwicket
full on leg stump, driven down to long-on
floated up outside leg stump, clipped away to deep backward square leg
back of a length, angling into off stump, punched past a diving extra cover fielder to long-off
full and flat on the pads, clipped away into the square leg region
flat, angling down leg, looks to work it leg side, and it tickles off his pads towards short fine leg
shortish, angling down leg, can't put bat to ball with the pull, hits him on the pad
length ball on middle stump, whipped to midwicket
flighted ball on off stump, driven to long-off
length ball on middle and leg, nurdled away to the right of square leg
down the track and Axar looks to fire it across Miller. Only ends up giving him more swinging room, and he uses it very well to launch a big six over long-off
full and flighted on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
flat and short on off stump, makes a bit of room to chop it away to deep point and bring the scores level
down the track and Axar fires it in quicker, on middle and off, giving no room. Tucked quietly to midwicket
quickish length ball on off stump, blocked into the off side
flat and short, angling into middle stump. Duminy clears his front leg and swats it away to the midwicket boundary to make it 2-0
